title: Which team will win the 2019 NBA Finals?
preds: No KD and down 3-2 makes me flip odds.
Raptors are slightly better team without full Golden State lineup. Therefore assume Golden State has 50% chance of winning at home in game 6, Raptors have 60% chance of winning at home in game 7.

Base rate: Teams that lead a best-of-seven series 3-2 go on to win the series 84.8% of the time (251-45).
538: 82%
Inside view:Despite the Raptors had one of their worst 3-point shooting games of the postseason(25%) and the Warriors' 20 3-pointers were the second-most for a team in a Finals game in NBA history(48%) (for a from beyond the arc 60-32 score) the Warriors won just by 1 point. Durant is out. Toronto is a better team right now. 90%.
Aggregation: 86%
We saw how KD impacted game 5 for only 10 minutes, but now that he's out, the Raptors have a clear path.

Raptors are up 3-2. KD is injured and out for good. Only one team has ever come back from 1-3 in the championship ('16 Cavs). Looney is expected to be healthy for game 6. Warriors are championship veterans and can perform under pressure.
Dragonfly aggregation: betting markets give the Warriors 30%. 538: 12%

Thought process:
Numerical odds are 25/75.
There is a small bias towards Raptors based on spreads of scores at each quarter.
Are there any other factors to rationalize my gut choice?
Durant reportedly will play tonight. Adjusting +3% for the Warriors
Injuries to the Warriors have significantly reduced their chances of winning the championship.

Base rate:
All-Time history of best-of-seven series in NBA playoffs
Teams that lead a best-of-seven series 3-1 go on to win the series 95.4% of the time (226-11) History of best-of-seven series in NBA playoffs ( since the 16-team playoff format began in 1984. The statistics are through the 2017 Playoffs.) Teams that lead a best-of-seven series 3-1 go on to win the series 95.6% of the time (152-7). Inside view:
Injury of K.Leonard is the main risk for Toronto(without him GS comeback is almost certain).
Base rate probability for injury in NBA: 19.3 per 1000 athlete exposures
http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.859.62&rep=rep1&type=pdf
Kawhi plays with minor injury, so I double the probability to 4% and add 1% for some miracle from GSW facing Toronto with Leonard and get 95%, which is close to the base rate .
Canadian team superior in all aspects of the game...fans too
Odds are 7 to 1 and no Durant

I think the GSW are playing mind games with the injury of KD and we won't see him return in the finals, it is still in doubt if Klay Thompson will make game 4 but I still believe that we will see at least a game 6.
Raptors lead 2-1 with 4 games left, two at home, two away.
Golden State injuries are pretty serious and will, no pun intended, hurt them

The teams are tied after two games, but Toronto have lost a home game. GSW now have three home games out of the next four, and if they win all three they'll be champions again. Raptors will have to win at least one away game to take it to the final game on their home court.
(aggregate of the odds and personal bias)

Updating odds based on first game in which the Raptors won. In the spirit of Tetlock's Dragonfly aggregation, I aggregate 538's (43-57) model with betting market odds (roughly 70-30%) https://www.oddsshark.com/nba/odds
https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2019-nba-predictions/
The warriors are too good. Injuries are the only possibility of them losing.
Long winning streak from the 1940's due to make a comeback.

The Golden State Warriors have continued to add size to their roster in the 2018-2019 season. With the addition of DeMarcus Cousins, the Warriors will be able to substitute the center position and dominate late stretches of games, unlike any other team in the NBA.  Rebounds late in games are key to a team's success. I predict the Warriors will defeat Houston in 7 games and the Raptors in 5 for the 2018-2019 Championship.

The western conference champion (Golden State Warriors) is most likely to win the 2019 NBA finals. There’s pretty wide agreement among experts that they’ll win the playoffs, and they’ve set a number of records since 2014, FiveThirtyEight’s CARMELO model gives them a 49% chance at winning the title, with a 9% chance for the Rockets.  https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/2019-nba-playoffs-brackets-predictions-experts-pick-warriors-to-win-title-again-disagree-over-their-finals/ https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/07/sports/houston-rockets-golden-state-warriors.html https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2823526-way-too-early-2019-nba-playoffs-predictions#slide0 https://www.teamrankings.com/nba/team/golden-state-warriors/projections https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2789744-2018-19-nba-schedule-win-loss-predictions-for-every-team https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/from-the-warriors-to-the-knicks-how-were-predicting-the-2018-19-nba/

The past two NBA champions have been the Golden State Warriors (Western Conference), who this year have the number one seed in the playoffs and have the best record in the NBA. This not only gives them home-court advantage in the Western Conference Playoffs but also in the NBA Finals. Teams with home-court advantage in playoffs since 2008 have had an average win percentage of 60%. The only player to beat the Golden State Warriors and win a Finals for the Eastern Conference in the past decade has been Lebron James (two time champion with the Miami Heat and a one time champion with the Cleveland Cavaliers) but he is on the Lakers and out of playoff contention. As for the Eastern Conference heavyweights this year (Boston, Philly, Milwaukee, and Toronto) they are  all plagued with Final's experience unlike the Warriors and all have never made the Finals before with their current rosters. While the Warriors roster has four years of Final experience under it. Therefore its likely that the Western Conference in particular the Warriors are going to advance to and win the NBA Finals. https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2019-nba-predictions/
https://bleacherreport.com/articles/1520496-how-important-is-home-court-advantage-in-the-nba

Aggregating from forecasts and betting markets: https://www.oddschecker.com/basketball/nba/nba-championship/winner
https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2019-nba-predictions/

However, that's probably not the right way to look at it, since strong teams will be knocking each other out. https://www.oddschecker.com/basketball/nba/nba-championship/winner Todays betting odds are 
Warriors 13/20 or about 60% and Rockets 13/2 or about 15%, or 75% for the top two Western teams. Bucks 11/2 or about 15%, Raptors 11/1 or 8%, totaling 23% for the top two Eastern teams. (538 had it much more even compared to the bookies). I'm splitting the difference for now.
The Warriors are so dominant this year.

The Eastern Conference division leads the Western Conference division by 38 to 32. In recent years, however, the Western conference has won 7 of the last 10 championships, three of them being the Golden State Warriors in relative succession. Barring the many extraneous variables that go into sports competitions, this pattern points to a likely chance that the Western conference will win again.
Depends on which seeds make it and home court, will be updated.
I follow basketball -- West and East both with have a champion that could win.
